values.title: Portal doesn't know about machines which have been terminated from elsewhere

content.raw:
I started a few machines and asked for the list of `/simulators` and they all show up properly.

Then I go to the AWS console and terminate them. Querying for `/simulators` after that still shows the terminated machines with the `LAUNCHING` status.
content.html:
I started a few machines and asked for the list of /simulators and they all show up properly.

Then I go to the AWS console and terminate them. Querying for /simulators after that still shows the terminated machines with the LAUNCHING status.

values.title: Add a route to get whether a user has permission to launch machines
Is the database cleaned up when the portal is re-deployed?

content.raw: It looked like it did this just now. Machines which had been launched before the portal being redeployed didn't show up on the list anymore, but they were live on AWS.
content.html: It looked like it did this just now. Machines which had been launched before the portal being redeployed didn't show up on the list anymore, but they were live on AWS.

values.title: Support machines which were launched by someone else

content.raw: At the moment, the portal is only able to communicate with the machines it launched, but there's no interface to adding a 3rd party's machine.
content.html: At the moment, the portal is only able to communicate with the machines it launched, but there's no interface to adding a 3rd party's machine.

values.title: Choose VPC in which machines are launched
It's possible for a machine to be lost

content.raw:
If a user launches a machine, doesn't share it with anyone, then revokes their own right to the machine, the machine is left without any users.

We could either not allow the last user to have the permission revoked, or kill a machine when it doesn't have any more users.
content.html:
If a user launches a machine, doesn't share it with anyone, then revokes their own right to the machine, the machine is left without any users.

We could either not allow the last user to have the permission revoked, or kill a machine when it doesn't have any more users.

values.title: Treat competitions as resources with permissions

content.raw:
We need an interface for:

* Creating / removing a competition
* Making users competition admins
* Making users competitors
* Changing / revoking user permissions
content.html:
We need an interface for:

  • Creating / removing a competition
  • Making users competition admins
  • Making users competitors
  • Changing / revoking user permissions

values.title: The portal could manage the amis available for each user
Tests fail locally if admin not "admin"

content.raw: It looks like the tests are using the same database as the server? Maybe it passes on codeship because they start from a clean db?
content.html: It looks like the tests are using the same database as the server? Maybe it passes on codeship because they start from a clean db?

values.title: Remove historic left-overs

content.raw: There seems to be a few left-overs from an old portal design, such as the mentions to "simulations" and the test directory structure.
content.html: There seems to be a few left-overs from an old portal design, such as the mentions to "simulations" and the test directory structure.

values.title: Reorganize code which still follows old MEAN stack

content.raw:
The new pattern can be seen in pull request #17. This involves:

* Removing the controllers / routes / models structure in favour of a single js file under `server/`

* Use csgrant's database instead of mongo
content.html:
The new pattern can be seen in pull request #17. This involves:

  • Removing the controllers / routes / models structure in favour of a single js file under server/

  • Use csgrant's database instead of mongo

values.title: improve performance with cloudsim-grant 0.3.2

content.raw:
It has a better version of 

copyInternalDatabase() that selects a single resource.
content.html:
It has a better version of

copyInternalDatabase() that selects a single resource.

values.title: occasional bad state transition from LAUNCHING to TERMINATED

content.raw:
It is possible for a new machine status to be set wrongly to TERMINATED. This happens occasionally in `server/controllers/simulator.js::updateInstanceStatus`

Problem: aws does not return information for the instance (because it's just been launched?), so the function determines that the machine is Terminated. 

fix: maybe allow a minimum time before validating a transition from the  launching state?

```
#!bash

This is what is reported by AWS (machine i-0fb3fe438d72949a0 is missing):

 { 'i-01144079a1aebd393': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0acdf5da1e56babc3': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-00a29727c176361dd': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0def8fa94bbfad7f2': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0324213b66783a865': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-04b1438460a8efd10': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0f14ed68383f2f94e': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0fffab3a0aaad1e07': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-07ee7c1fcac4d6084': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-02cf7861ed45b0ee4': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0bad1af741868f092': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0cebbfbe059135fd6': 'RUNNING',
  'i-05adbf7b98a0ac7bd': 'TERMINATING',
  'i-035124443f79069bf': 'RUNNING' } 
*

This is the new state for instance i-0fb3fe438d72949a0

 { status: 'TERMINATED',
  region: 'us-west-1',
  hardware: 'm4.large',
  image: 'ami-ac5500cc',
  creator: 'cloudsim@osrfoundation.org',
  launch_date: '2016-11-14T20:56:19.176Z',
  termination_date: null,
  machine_ip: '',
  machine_id: 'i-0fb3fe438d72949a0',
  id: 'simulator-699' }
i-0fb3fe438d72949a0 simulator-699 status update LAUNCHING => TERMINATED


```
content.html:
It is possible for a new machine status to be set wrongly to TERMINATED. This happens occasionally in server/controllers/simulator.js::updateInstanceStatus

Problem: aws does not return information for the instance (because it's just been launched?), so the function determines that the machine is Terminated.

fix: maybe allow a minimum time before validating a transition from the launching state?

This is what is reported by AWS (machine i-0fb3fe438d72949a0 is missing):

 { 'i-01144079a1aebd393': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0acdf5da1e56babc3': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-00a29727c176361dd': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0def8fa94bbfad7f2': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0324213b66783a865': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-04b1438460a8efd10': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0f14ed68383f2f94e': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0fffab3a0aaad1e07': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-07ee7c1fcac4d6084': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-02cf7861ed45b0ee4': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0bad1af741868f092': 'TERMINATED',
  'i-0cebbfbe059135fd6': 'RUNNING',
  'i-05adbf7b98a0ac7bd': 'TERMINATING',
  'i-035124443f79069bf': 'RUNNING' } 
*

This is the new state for instance i-0fb3fe438d72949a0

 { status: 'TERMINATED',
  region: 'us-west-1',
  hardware: 'm4.large',
  image: 'ami-ac5500cc',
  creator: 'cloudsim@osrfoundation.org',
  launch_date: '2016-11-14T20:56:19.176Z',
  termination_date: null,
  machine_ip: '',
  machine_id: 'i-0fb3fe438d72949a0',
  id: 'simulator-699' }
i-0fb3fe438d72949a0 simulator-699 status update LAUNCHING => TERMINATED

values.title: Open port 5000 on arbiter machine

content.raw: For SASC, we need TCP 5000 open to allow access to the game director. Doing this assumes that the game director web app handles its own security and user management.
content.html: For SASC, we need TCP 5000 open to allow access to the game director. Doing this assumes that the game director web app handles its own security and user management.

values.title: Add project name to EC2 machine

content.raw:
Having the emails is great to know who to track down. But right now there's no differentiation between the SASC simulator and the precious? simulator. Except for the machine type.  

simulator-398_sloretz@osrfoundation.org
vs
simulator-218_tfoote@osrfoundation.org

It would be great to have PROJECT-COMPUTERTYPE-XXX_user@domain.com for the name
content.html:
Having the emails is great to know who to track down. But right now there's no differentiation between the SASC simulator and the precious? simulator. Except for the machine type.

simulator-398_sloretz@osrfoundation.org vs simulator-218_tfoote@osrfoundation.org

It would be great to have PROJECT-COMPUTERTYPE-XXX_user@domain.com for the name

values.title: bad ssh keys generated for SASC "test 37" round

content.raw:
I'm not sure where to file this. 

I can't download ssh keys from any of the machines successfully. They all give invalid zip files. 

They are based on the AMI I just created: ami-fe99c49e

I left the round running in production for debugging.

values.title: ssh keys sometimes are not valid

content.raw:
Today I had to start 4 rounds before I could get one with 3 valid ssh keys  (sim, blue, and gold)

I got an error on creating the machine.

![error_creating_sshkey.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ykbEq8/images/1807397850-error_creating_sshkey.png)

And then after waiting for the server to come up I got a bad tarball. 

 ![bad_tarball.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ykbEq8/images/3268337358-bad_tarball.png)

This fist happened with blue and gold, the 2nd round was all 3 bad. The 3rd round the simulator was bad and the 4th round they were all good.

tftest, tftest2, tftest3 and tftest4 I left tftest running for an example in case someone wants to look at it while running.
content.html:
Today I had to start 4 rounds before I could get one with 3 valid ssh keys (sim, blue, and gold)

I got an error on creating the machine.

And then after waiting for the server to come up I got a bad tarball.

This fist happened with blue and gold, the 2nd round was all 3 bad. The 3rd round the simulator was bad and the 4th round they were all good.

tftest, tftest2, tftest3 and tftest4 I left tftest running for an example in case someone wants to look at it while running.

content.raw:

It's gold 1.

sascround-173

values.title: Improve error detection if amazon fails to provision

content.raw:
We just observed a machine failing to boot after being provisioned. #!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/issues/19/sasc-one-machine-didnt-come-up-in-a

It would be great to monitor their status and be able to know/catch this. 

Refiling this as an enhancement for the backlog.
content.html:
We just observed a machine failing to boot after being provisioned. #!/osrf/cloudsim-portal/issues/19/sasc-one-machine-didnt-come-up-in-a

It would be great to monitor their status and be able to know/catch this.

Refiling this as an enhancement for the backlog.

values.title: Use more unique name than keys.zip

content.raw:
The keys.zip files are really opaque; it's hard to know where they came from. It would be nice to give them a more unique name somehow.

cc @tfoote
content.html:
The keys.zip files are really opaque; it's hard to know where they came from. It would be nice to give them a more unique name somehow.

cc @tfoote
